items.title: Why it took nearly 30 minutes for police to evacuate Perth Invasion Day rally
items.description: As police face criticism for their handling of Perth's Invasion Day rally bomb scare, a law enforcement expert says they faced a "no-win situation".

items.title: First Nations leaders welcome Invasion Day rally terror probe
items.description: Noongar woman Hannah McGlade is among many First Nations leaders who say WA Police's decision to investigate Monday's alleged Invasion Day rally attack as "a potential terrorist attack" is a step in the right direction.

items.title: Hastie and Taylor meet in attempt to resolve Liberal leadership — as it happened
items.description: Andrew Hastie, Angus Taylor and senior conservative Liberals have met in Melbourne to resolve the Liberal leadership amid speculation Sussan Ley may face a leadership spill.

items.title: Trump threatens Iran with 'major destruction' as US fleet arrives in Gulf
items.description: The US president says Tehran should make a deal or face military strikes as tensions between the two countries escalate.

items.title: How the Trump administration plans to control Venezuela's oil money
items.description: Until this week the Trump administration had provided few details about how involved it would be in the governance of Venezuela. New information suggests it will look to hold the purse strings for some time.

items.title: Live: 'They simply cannot survive': Heatwave has huge impact on wildlife
items.description: NSW is on high alert for bushfires as temperatures above 40 degrees Celsius persist and firefighters continue to battle multiple blazes across Victoria.

items.title: Police detail discovery of remains in private Celine Cremer search
items.description: Police are holding a media conference in Tasmania, following the shock discovery of human bones in the remote area where a Belgian backpacker went missing more than two years ago.

items.title: Minnesota agents put on leave as Trump says mayor is 'playing with fire'
items.description: The Trump administration is trying to manage a national uproar over Alex Pretti's killing and officials' subsequent comments about the 37-year-old nurse, who they accused of "domestic terrorism".

items.title: A deadly virus has been re-detected in India. Asian countries are taking no chances
items.description: Two cases of the Nipah virus have been detected in India, prompting a raft of screening measures to be enacted in countries across Asia.

items.title: RBA warned to 'tread carefully' or risk hitting stressed borrowers for six
items.description: The Reserve Bank cut interest rates three times last year, betting inflation would moderate. But that hasn't happened, and now a rate hike looks likely next month — and possibly another in May.

items.title: Boys and girls detained together without access to health staff, report finds
items.description: The Northern Territory's children's commissioner says she is "incredibly disappointed" after the corrections department rejected all recommendations from a two-year investigation into the NT's youth detention system.

items.title: Live: Aussie men's doubles pair showdown ahead of women's semifinals
items.description: Australian pair Jason Kubler and Marc Polmans vie for a spot in the men's doubles final on day 12, while later tonight two-time champion Aryna Sabalenka headlines a women's singles semifinals double-header. Follow live.

items.title: Live: ASX slides as Wall Street drifts on Fed decision
items.description: The US Fed's decision to hold interest rates has kept a lid on Wall Street trading while the ASX has stumbled on opening. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Malaysian soccer bosses quit over disastrous 'cheating' scandal
items.description: A scandal in which foreign players were improperly granted citizenship to play for the national team leads to the "voluntary" resignation of the executive committee of Malaysian soccer's governing body.

items.title: Barron Trump's intervention helps convict man of assault halfway across the world
items.description: A Russian man who became jealous of a woman's friendship with the youngest son of US President Donald Trump has been found guilty of assaulting her by a London court.

items.title: How to see more ABC News stories in Google Search
items.description: Google now lets you choose which publisher you want to see more of in your search results. Here's a step-by-step guide to ensuring the latest ABC News stories appear at the top of your feed.

items.title: The performers working to ease the 'loneliness epidemic' in aged care
items.description: Former aged care workers Marina Lee-Warner and Julie Joy have created a live show tailored to older Australians, including those facing cognitive decline.

items.title: Minister says 'mountain is falling off' on notorious transport route
items.description: The NSW government has announced a fresh assessment of a key transport route recently closed by a 200-tonne landslip, but residents say it has all been done before.

items.title: Tasmania takes control of ore stockpile after Liberty Bell Bay defaults on loan
items.description: The Tasmanian government appoints receivers and managers to protect the manganese ore stockpile paid for by taxpayers at the Liberty Bell Bay smelter in the state's north.

items.title: Woman faces court for allegedly assaulting stranger's newborn baby
items.description: A woman aged in her 50s has faced the ACT Magistrates Court over the incident. WARNING: This story contains distressing details about an alleged assault on a baby.

items.title: Would-be tenants queried on 'lifestyle' in 50-question rental applications
items.description: Tenants are being forced to hand over excessive personal data when applying for rental properties, with new research warning that applicants' personal information could be at risk.

items.title: Travel agents overwhelmed by new UK passport rules
items.description: New passport rules for UK-Australian dual citizens have customers in "tears", say travel agents who are working through the night to help.

items.title: 15 dead after plane crashes in mountainous region of Colombia
items.description: A plane crash in north-east Colombia kills all 15 people on board, including a local lawmaker.

items.title: These are the sticking points as phase two of the Gaza ceasefire arrives
items.description: The body of the final Israeli hostage has been returned, but uncertainty remains about the future of the strip, including who will oversee its administration, whether Hamas will disarm and the withdrawal of Israeli assets.

items.title: Jetstar twice violated own policy on fees for changing support worker's name
items.description: The 22-year-old northern Tasmanian man with a disability was incorrectly told he'd have to pay a fee to change the name of his support worker on a ticket. After an apology and a refund, it happened again.
